an5.237:1.1: “Mendicants, a resident mendicant with five qualities is cast down to hell.
an5.237:1.3: Without examining or scrutinizing, they praise those deserving of criticism,
an5.237:1.4: and they criticize those deserving of praise.
an5.237:1.5: They’re stingy and avaricious regarding monasteries.
an5.237:1.6: They’re stingy and avaricious regarding families.
an5.237:1.7: And they waste a gift given in faith.
an5.237:1.8: A resident mendicant with these five qualities is cast down to hell.
an5.237:2.1: A resident mendicant with five qualities is raised up to heaven.
an5.237:2.3: After examining and scrutinizing, they criticize those deserving of criticism,
an5.237:2.4: and they praise those deserving of praise.
an5.237:2.5: They’re not stingy and avaricious regarding monasteries.
an5.237:2.6: They’re not stingy and avaricious regarding families.
an5.237:2.7: And they don’t waste a gift given in faith.
an5.237:2.8: A resident mendicant with these five qualities is raised up to heaven.”
